title: Photography
text:
Due to the impact of COVID-19 and my research activities for my Master’s degree, I am trying to participate in the bicycle long-distance event Brevet, which has been on hiatus since 2016; I aim to complete 200 km, 300 km, 400 km and 600 km in order to be able to participate in PBP 2027. Through self-portraits I capture the essence of my own being and reflect on my own journey through time. Each photograph is a reflection of my own experiences and emotions. Through these photos I hope to offer a glimpse into my life as a learner and explorer, and to inspire others to reflect on their own round-the-world journeys.

title: Projects
text:
arXiv Preprint | Code
Over the centuries, I have devoted countless hours to deciphering and translating the ancient scripts and dialects of the various peoples of Middle-earth. My goal is to gain a deeper understanding of the cultures and histories of these peoples by studying their languages. Currently, I am working on a monograph that explores the linguistic roots of the Elvish languages. Through extensive research and analysis, I hope to shed light on the connections between the different dialects of Elvish and their origins. This project has been particularly challenging, as Elvish is a complex and nuanced language, but I am determined to see it through to completion.

title: Projects
section: The History of the War of the Ring
text:
The History of the War of the Ring

arXiv Preprint | Code
I am creating a comprehensive and detailed history of the conflict that goes beyond the surface-level events. By gathering information from a variety of sources, including my own memories, written accounts, and oral histories, I hope to shed new light on this important period in Middle-earth’s history and provide valuable insights into the motivations and actions of the various players involved.

title: Welcome to my website!
text:
Twitter
  
  
    
     Github
  
  
    
     LinkedIn
  
  
    
     Email
  




Welcome to my website!
Thank you for visiting my web site.First of all, I would like to see a world in which people of all ages and both sexes can ride a bicycle in a safe and healthy way, while enjoying a sense of exhilaration and achievement.
My research interests focus on cycling, particularly long-distance rides in which participants must complete a pre-determined course, passing pre-determined checkpoints.
I was awarded a Master’s degree from Mukogawa Women’s University Graduate School of Health and Sports Science in Spring 2023 for my research on “Investigating the use of bicycles for lifelong healthy living among middle-aged and elderly people - an intervention using subjective exercise intensity -”. I am currently looking for a place on a PhD programme and would like to continue my research. I use the R language for research analysis, but I am still a beginner.
My master’s thesis can be found in the following repository: My Master’s Thesis
I would like to express my gratitude to Marvin Schmitt and his template below for his kindness in making this template available to me. Marvin Schmitt contact me if you have any questions or would like to discuss potential projects.
